item.title: When Christmas is a little too bright ... look to Krampus
item.description: If Santa Claus is the good cop of Christmas, then Krampus is the bad one: a creature from European folklore who scares children into behaving themselves, complete with goat horns and gnashing teeth.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Syria marks a year since Assad fled, but struggles to heal
item.description: Syria is struggling to heal a year after the Assad dynasty's repressive 50-year reign came to an end following 14 years of civil war that left the country battered and divided.

item.title: Former Trump attorney Alina Habba resigns as top federal prosecutor in New Jersey
item.description: Habba's decision comes as the Justice Department has lost a string of court cases ruling that U.S. attorneys have not been appointed legally, including in Nevada, California and Virginia.

item.title: FBI agents sue after being fired for kneeling during racial justice protest
item.description: The FBI agents kneeled during a protest in 2020 not to reflect a left-wing political view, but to de-escalate a volatile situation, they say in court papers. The FBI fired them in September.

item.title: Not so fast, Netflix. Paramount launches hostile bid for Warner Bros. Discovery
item.description: Paramount has launched a hostile bid for the company that's home to Casablanca, Batman and CNN. Just Friday, Netflix and Warner Brothers executives were celebrating a deal they had struck.

item.title: China's trade surplus hits $1 trillion for first time ever
item.description: China's exports to the U.S. have dropped sharply this year, in the face of President Trump's tariffs — but the country is still finding plenty of customers elsewhere around the world.

item.title: ICEBlock app sues Trump administration for censorship and 'unlawful threats'
item.description: The app lets people anonymously share the locations of immigration agents but Apple removed it from its app store under pressure from the Trump administration. Now, the app's developer is suing.

item.title: After Texas ruling, Trump and Republicans head to 2026 with a redistricting edge
item.description: Trump has prompted a redistricting race as he tries to maintain Republican control of the House in the 2026 elections. Democrats have fewer options to counter, as the battle heads into next year.
